alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 04 at 1:37AM MST until January 04 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT LATE THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITIES... .Drier, windy, and warmer than normal conditions will return to the East Central Plains late this morning through this afternoon along with moderate instability. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Critical fire weather conditions may become widespread over the East Central Plains by midday Tuesday then persist through late afternoon before diminishing. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
